summary: The House of Habsburg was a powerful royal family in Europe. They got their name from Habsburg Castle in Switzerland. One of their ancestors, Rudolph, became King of the Romans in 1273. Over time, they ruled many places, including Austria, Bohemia, Hungary, and Spain. The family split into different branches but stayed close and often married each other. They held important titles and ruled until the 20th century. Today, Karl von Habsburg is the head of this famous dynasty.
title: House of Habsburg
